instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on 20V
threads.message:
Good afternoon, guys.

The MacBook had gotten wet, the damaged components have already been replaced (including <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>), it manages to go up to 20V - 1.30A but it resets to 0A.
Reviewing the Power sequencing diagram, the voltages reach the part of H9M LOAD SECURE ROM, SMC BATTERY TRAP: the last voltage before the restart, is the <SIGNAL>PCH_RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>; from there, there are no more voltages.

PPBUS = 12.57

Thanks and regards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on 20V

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 75040, member: 682"]
It is recognized in DFU?
[/QUOTE]

Yes sir.

I try to update it, the progress bar advances 5-10%, quickly reaches the end and after several minutes, it throws error 4005.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not turning on 20V
threads.message:
Did you try revive, or restore option?
Be aware, restore will erase SSD; but must be needed.
